text: I really do need a `Vector`  - it seems the point of adapt(T, x) is to allow returning something compatible with T, but not necessarily T

elements.text: - it seems the point of adapt(T, x) is to allow returning something compatible with T, but not necessarily T

text:
Ah, I guess I misunderstood Adapt. For what it's worth, this works:
```julia> using Adapt

julia> let v = [1, 3]
           @btime adapt(Vector, $v)
       end
  1.549 ns (0 allocations: 0 bytes)
2-element Vector{Int64}:
 1
 3

julia> let v = Set([1, 3])
           @btime adapt(Vector, $v)
       end
  1.299 ns (0 allocations: 0 bytes)
Set{Int64} with 2 elements:
  3
  1```
